title: TSM v C9
body:
C9 gets a brand new mid in Incarnati0n and beats the "best" team in NA in TSM. I am a massive TSM fan, have been since season 2, but the game has shifted and it just isn't good enough to play tanky initiators and not make plays in the top lane. Balls Rumble is a perfect representation of that. I can't remember the last time that Dyrus carried a game. I think I remember it happening one game last season as Sion. 

He either needs to step his game up and start making plays again or it is time for him to move on. The fact that Bjergsen had almost a 100 cs lead in the mid lane and they wren't able to win that game is on Dyrus and WildTurtle.

replies.body:
The urgot pick was lame. Why pick urgot? Bjerg had the only damage on the team......
Why did't TSM ban Rumble?

> [{quoted}](name=Katrina Steiner,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=agI7IbrQ,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-05-30T20:19:49.167+0000)
>
> The urgot pick was lame. Why pick urgot? Bjerg had the only damage on the team......
> Why did't TSM ban Rumble?

TSM was more scared of Sneaky's Ashe than giving away the Rumble. Yeah it's Balls' Rumble, but giving away Ashe is also really risky for a few reasons: 1. The Ashe synergizes well with Morgana (who'd also be a huge denial pick) and those are two champions both Sneaky and Lemon are extremely comfortable on. Another reason would be if Balls gets ahead, it's not always the end of the world unless he's on something like Hecarim, but if an ADC like Sneaky gets ahead, you're gonna be hard-pressed to try and shut him down.
Not really lck plays maokai still. What really needed is decisive shoutcalling, bjerg isnt cutting it. Make lustboy do it.

when a champion who loses by 70cs or whatever in the laning phase get 1 damage item and starts winning the game, you realize there is a problem. AP Kog, is pretty rediculous by design. Its pretty crazy he can finish a Ludens that far behind, and start winning the game.

That said, I'm glad C9 won. Also, just seeing Incarnation on stream, he looked overrated anyways. He was always losing lane or losing games. I know I watched one stream where Slooshi solo killed him 2 times in lane. I thought NA had weak mids?

> [{quoted}](name=DestructoDave,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=agI7IbrQ,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-05-30T20:35:11.752+0000)

> when a champion who loses by 70cs or whatever in the laning phase get 1 damage item and starts winning the game, you realize there is a problem. AP Kog, is pretty rediculous by design. Its pretty crazy he can finish a Ludens that far behind, and start winning the game.

> That said, I'm glad C9 won. Also, just seeing Incarnation on stream, he looked overrated anyways. He was always losing lane or losing games. I know I watched one stream where Slooshi solo killed him 2 times in lane. I thought NA had weak mids?

Don't look at it like this
Apollo beats every adc in solo queue, but in lcs he is out performed by many.

> [{quoted}](name=xJLx MCHammer,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=agI7IbrQ,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2015-05-30T20:44:36.069+0000)
>
> Don't look at it like this
> Apollo beats every adc in solo queue, but in lcs he is out performed by many.

What are you getting at? Bjerg doubled his CS. So, he pulled an Apollo at both places; solo Q and in LCS. He lost lane about as bad as Hai ever did. If not worse. I guess once he faces someone besides Bjerg we will see, but he looks overrated.

> [{quoted}](name=DestructoDave,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=agI7IbrQ,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2015-05-30T21:49:34.428+0000)

Berg never fought him though

In apollos case, he beats double lift and sneaky in solo q but loses in lcs

> [{quoted}](name=xJLx MCHammer,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=agI7IbrQ,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2015-05-30T20:44:36.069+0000)
>
> Don't look at it like this
> Apollo beats every adc in solo queue, but in lcs he is out performed by many.

you drunk? apollo is actually better than the be famed wildturtle.. stated by doublift and sneaky. wildturtle looks so great because bjergsen was always fed last season so bjerg would do a million damage and turtle would get fed or they would focus bjerg so turtle would be free and look good. apollo is consistently playing well. may not look flash through all the rush impact wei xiao madness but if you look at him and his play its stellar or at least better than wildturtle. he is super under-rated

<PIcks 1 threat comp>
> All Dyrus' fault. 

Dyrus did well that game actually the problem is balls literally cannot lose a professional game on rumble. He's never lost on it. IN MORE THAN 10 GAMES. The rumble ults literally won an unwinnable game. Rumble ults ate Vic's flash like 5 times and burned everything to make Vic have to run instead. Vic isn't a safe late game champ unlike kog (Which is one of the safest 40 minute mid laners.
He's lost plenty of games on Rumble. None of those were in the regular season of Spring/Summer LCS, though.

> [{quoted}](name=KilljoyX,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=agI7IbrQ,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2015-05-31T14:33:13.633+0000)

The rumble ults literally won an unwinnable game. Rumble ults ate Vic's flash like 5 times and burned everything to make Vic have to run instead. Vic isn't a safe late game champ unlike kog (Which is one of the safest 40 minute mid laners.

IEM Katowice
more than anything why not ban {{champion:68}}... Balls was 16-0 with him(now 17-0)

The meta is shifting. If people continue to play tanks you're gonna end up seeing the ultimate team-fighting, tank assassin adc: {{champion:29}} and assassins/fighters/bruisers in general.


To a degree yes it was the Kog'Maw being able to scale into level 16 with ludens but it could have been all avoided if Santorin knew how to gank. Bjergsen played it well, i'm not sure who the shot caller is but they sure as hell need a better one.
it's bjergsen mostly with chime in from the others, but he is the main voice

Maokai isn't a hard initiator. His primary role in teamfights in peeling, so when you have him as your **primary initiator** and the game goes on that long, as shown, you're gonna lose. 

I would've preferred to see a Sion or Mundo, both of whom can bypass Rumble ult fairly easily and keep the enemy backline busy.

Honestly, TSM was winning. Then they over-confidently went into a tight gap versus a Rumble and paid for it. That lead to multiple objectives going down. 

I think it is fair to say that TSM threw the game. At that point. Their comp required they have more levels and more items on all of their members to win. That one loss team fight. Negated all advantages (Incarnati0n was 4.1.6 while being 80 CS down at this point but still had the same number of items as Bjerg).
imo mid was winning but it felt like all the other lanes were losing

No the whole team was winning. Then they threw...hard. And C9 capitalized on it.

Wildturtle was not playing a carry. Urgot is an anti-carry and sadly, he couldn't anti-carry enough.

Bjerg won mid, but Incarnati0n didn't feed, just persisted until late game AP kog got on line.

Santorin was the only failure on the team for TSM. He didn't do much of anything this game...much the same we have seen from him since MSI. I don't know what happened to him, maybe Regi yelled at him. He isn't playing how he normally does.

Guys this happens every season. TSM may not be doing the best at the start of the season but they sure show their power toward the end. And if you guys are true TSM fans then you would believe in them not hate.
but... im not a tsm fan
the fact that bjer had a 100 cs lead and DIDNT carry is his fault. When you are set up to carry (like how TSM plays) its up to you to carry.
Nah, it was all Dyrus.

It's more about kog than anything else. Balls isn't that great, in fact last split, he did really bad. 
To plane represents the jungle and team coordination.
No its on kog maw being able to poke from a full screen away. TSM did split up way too much in team fights, but kog'maw is a ludicrous design
